column5: Definition: “Kidnapping” means unlawfully detaining a person or persons against their will (including through the use of force; threat; fraud or enticement) for the purpose of demanding for their liberation an illicit gain or any other economic gain or other material benefit; or in order to oblige someone to do or not to do something. “Kidnapping” should exclude disputes over child custody
Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of China
The former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia

column1: Please note that when using the figures, any cross-national comparisons should be conducted with caution because of the differences that exist between the legal definitions of offences in countries, or the different methods of offence counting and recording.
* Changes in definitions and/or counting rules are reported by the Member State to indicate a break in the time series.
** Data for Canada represent offences of kidnapping and forcible confinement and the data do not permit these to be presented separately.
